We encourage anyone part of our church family to find transformation, discipleship, and growth in a small community.
Most of our communities meet weekly to study God's Word, pray, and encourage one another in faith.
To join a community, visit Park Communities or contact us.
Our youth group Cornerstone meets every Wednesday at church from 6:00-7:00pm. If you are at secondary school, we would love to see you there.
We also run a youth Bible study during selected Sunday gatherings for Years 7-10.
Find out more about Park Youth.
St John's Park church building and grounds
The address of the church is Bernard Street, Sheffield, S2 5PU.
We have a steep driveway to a car park just off Bernard Street with limited parking.

Overflow parking is available in the car park behind the flats at the top of the church grounds. From Bernard Street, turn onto Cricket Inn Road, then the first major right onto Maltravers Road, then right again onto St John's Street. Follow the road to the end of the car park and use the public footpath through the old churchyard to reach church.
We have good public transport links. Hyde Park tram stop is right next to the church.

A community of Jesus-followers in Park, Sheffield.
We belong to the family of God,
love and serve our city,
and give Jesus praise in everything we do.
Find transformation, discipleship, and growth through midweek groups, Kids, and Youth communities.
Join one of our teams and help our church family thrive in worship, welcome, and community service.
Your generosity helps sustain Sunday gatherings, midweek ministries, and practical support across our city.
Here is what makes a Sunday morning at St John's Park easy to step into.
We gather to worship every Sunday morning at 10:45am. We also run activities during the week for children, local community support, and smaller groups.
What happens in a church service?
The service is usually a little over an hour. We sing together, read the Bible, hear teaching that connects Scripture to everyday life, and spend time in prayer.
On the first Sunday of each month, we also share Communion together.
What about children and young people?
Children are very welcome. Most Sundays there is a children’s activity or children’s club during the service, and we work to help families feel at home.
For more details, visit Park Kids and Park Youth.

Here is a step-by-step guide for what happens when visiting St John's Park Church on a Sunday.
When I arrive at St John's Park Church I will see a big blue open door with a ramp for wheelchair access.
I will go inside two sets of doors and then there will be someone at the back of church to say hello to me.
There will be ear defenders and activity bags for me to use if I want to. I am allowed to borrow them without asking.
The toilets are in the side hallway. There is also an accessible toilet and I am allowed to use it even if I don't have a disability.
In church I can sit on any of the available seats. If I have a wheelchair I am welcome to sit wherever I feel most comfortable.
When the service is ready to start, the person leading will say hello and tell us what is happening.
During the service we will sing songs. I can stand up or sit down to sing. It is OK to move around, dance or wave a flag.
After the Family Song, I will be invited to go into the side hall for kids activities. There is circle time, games, stories and a craft. It is OK to stay in the main service.
After the service I can stay for a drink and a biscuit and talk to people. If I don't want to do this, that is OK and I can go home with my family when we are ready.
Children playing in the church park
Our Park Kids groups are for children aged 1-11 and run during our Sunday gathering at 10:45am.
Children start in the service with the church family and then move into age-appropriate groups for Bible teaching, prayer, and activities.
Park Youth gathered together in the garden
Cornerstone is our youth group for secondary school age, meeting every Wednesday at church from 6:00pm-7:00pm.
We spend time together in Scripture, discussion, prayer, and friendship.
If you are a parent/carer or young person and would like more details, get in touch.

We also run a youth Bible study during selected Sunday gatherings for Years 7-10.
Our heart is to help young people know Jesus, grow in faith, and play a full part in church life.
St John's is committed to high standards in the safeguarding and care of children and vulnerable adults.
Download our safeguarding policy: St John's Safeguarding Policy 2025 (DOCX).
The Diocese of Sheffield's Safeguarding Adviser is Siân Checkley. Contact: 01709 309100 or 07741 013775, or email sian.checkley@sheffield.anglican.org.
Catch up on our latest Sunday talks.
Hear the Bible read, explained, and applied to everyday life through talks from members of our church family.
We are a church family, and we need different people to help our family thrive. If you are part of St John's, we encourage you to join and serve one of our teams.
Interested in joining a team? Please get in touch.
Our welcome and hospitality team create the family environment we love at St John's Park. They welcome people at the door, serve refreshments, and make sure everyone receives a warm welcome.
Our Park Kids team disciples the youngest generation in our church, from under-5s through primary-aged children.
We disciple young people through Sunday Bible study and our midweek youth group Cornerstone, helping them meet and grow in relationship with Jesus.
Our worship team helps us encounter God's presence and give him praise.
Our Food Bank team serves local people in crisis, providing food parcels and a listening, friendly ear.
Our lunch club team helps serve lunch and build relationships in this richly diverse, lively community.
Our cleaning team enables us to welcome people into the building during the week and gather together on Sundays.
Our car park team helps fit everyone in so we can gather together on a Sunday.
Our creative team uses photography, social media, and video to show what God is doing locally and help people connect with church family.
Our production team makes sure everyone can see and hear clearly during Sunday gatherings.
Please join us for refreshments afterwards to hang out as church family.
Join us for our Sunday gathering every week at 10:45am. We gather to worship Jesus, hear the Bible read and explained, and to pray.

St John's is part of the Church of England in the Diocese of Sheffield. We are committed to being followers of Jesus who love and learn from God, support each other, and serve our community and beyond.
Our faith is well summarized in the Apostles' Creed, shared by Christians around the world through the centuries.
We believe in God the Father, in Jesus Christ his Son, and in the Holy Spirit; in forgiveness, resurrection, and eternal life in Christ.
The St John's Park food bank is provided in collaboration with Sheffield Food and Community Trust and Trussell.
The food bank is accessible by referral only, and provides an emergency parcel for those in food crisis.
To request a referral for a food parcel call either:
Help Through Hardship: 08082082138 Monday to Friday 9am - 5pm. Translators available.
Citizens Advice Sheffield: 08082787820 Monday to Friday 10am - 4pm. Select option 4 for Advice Line.
Sheffield S6 helpline: 0114 321 0733 Monday to Friday 10am-1pm.
At the food bank, we offer support with more than just food; Citizens Advice and Debt Support workers are available during the food bank session for those with referrals.
If you are interested in volunteering at our food bank, please contact Hannah Graham for more information: hannah@saintjohnspark.org.
St John's Park, Bernard Street, S2 5PU
Anyone with a referral from a support worker or agency
Join us every Monday for soup, bread, a hot drink, and a chat. All are welcome, and it is free.
Monday to Friday at 8:00am for 30 minutes on Zoom.
We also meet in church on the first Sunday of each month from 10:00-10:30am before the service.
Throughout the year we host seasonal gatherings for all ages, including Christmas events and community celebrations.
